title: In what ways has visualizing helped you in your daily life? - Quora

response.answer_text: In what ways has visualizing helped you in your daily life? Your question is good. We all use visualization, along with, imagination to so our next thing that we do. That’s according to scientific research on movement. We, even in habits, tend to use visualization for our next move. Such as brushing our teeth, stepping on the gas or avoiding dog-do.  It helps to keep us moving in a direction we want to go . . . I, like most everyone, have used visualization to do our jobs, be they skills, a profession, cutting the lawn or our kids hair. To, see the finished product. We use visualization to understand where we are going or doing next. When folks talk of visualization, they usually mean cognitive visualizing. Taking command, of my visions and imaginations. Similar to a painter deciding on which color to use, Our, could be lovers with a first kiss. Some folks create “Visualization Boards” and pin, stick or tape their wants and imaginings too. We all visualize . . .

There was a great study done at Texas A&M. It showed that parts of your mind don't know the difference between an actual event and imagining an event. I knew I could do it because I had done it before is the subconscious message implanted by visualization. It is a powerful force.
